title: Changes create to new on transaction library
body:
Changes create to new on transaction library

Create took two optional params, object_id and related_id
and would do a create + get if they were passed. However,
having changed create to accept named key arguments, we
now need those key values for regular transaction parameters
in order to make proposal actions generic in the way the API
calls them. Thus, the new method only creates an object and
returns the status, and get should be called separately.

Changing the method name from "create" to "new" to support 
an object named create on the library, as we have user.create 
and user.import messages.

PR addresses issue #678, a dependency of #379

A decision was made to move ValidationExceptions beyond the validator function into getters for users/groups. Because of this, determining where a ValidationError comes from is less obvious/complicated, and the delta_outbound_sync worked around this by putting everything into a try/catch block.

This PR narrows the focus of the try/catch for ValidationException to the specific user/group functions that eventually throw it. There is no new functionality here, and this work was done while troubleshooting yesterday's pile of issues.

title: Onboard chatbot engine
body:
## Reading:
[Understand the Rasa Stack](https://rasa.com/docs/get_started_step1/)

> The Rasa Stack is a framework to build contextual AI assistants and chatbots. It consists of two open source libraries (Rasa NLU and Rasa Core).

[NLU](https://rasa.com/docs/nlu/)

> Rasa NLU is an open-source natural language processing tool for intent classification and entity extraction in chatbots. For example, taking a sentence like

[Architecture](https://rasa.com/docs/core/architecture/)

## In this PR:
- Add Docker service based on Rasa Core from `rasa/rasa_core:0.12.2`
- Add WebSocket route to server for handling chatbot requests
- Add NLU language processor
- Add script to train Core and NLU
- Add initial training data

## Gist:
- `bin/train` trains Core and NLU from documents in `/chatbot`
- Core server waits for incoming requests on port 5005
- JS client sends message payload to `/api/chatbot` over `ws://` as serialized JSON
- REST server POSTs to Core server, providing it conversational context via user ID
- Core server replies with chatbot response `->` REST server responds `->` Client displays view

## Notes:
- Client changes not included

## Todo:
- Conversations exist in memory. Create adapter for Rethink.
- REST auth middleware doesn't yet use token from socket handshake

title: Re-Addressing Scheme
body:
Migrates to a new blockchain addressing scheme

Address is a 35-byte (70 character) lowercase hexadecimal string
        in the following format:
            3-bytes (6 characters): Transaction Family Namespace
            2-bytes (4 characters): Reserved (zero bytes)
            2-bytes (4 characters): Hex representation of the object type (enum value)
            12-bytes (24 characters): Hash of the object id
            2-bytes (4 characters): Hex representation of the related object type (enum value)
            1-byte (2 characters): Hex representation of the relationship type (enum value)
            12-bytes (24 characters): Hash of the related object id or zero bytes if None
            1-byte (2 characters): Reserved (zero bytes)

and will utilize a simulated version of PoET. The Next Directory UI

http://10.5.0.70:4200

http://10.5.0.72:4200
http://10.5.0.73:4200

[Task] | Provides a default config for localhost out-of-the-box

Task Title | Provides a default config for localhost out-of-the-box
T-shirt size | M
Story Points - Fibonacci (1,2,3,5,8,13) | 5

The current sources provide a config.sample.py that is to be
copied and renamed to config.py before the application can deploy
to localhost. There are a number of issues with the current setup.
When config.py is missing:

  *  The app builds and deploys without errors
  *  Errors in the server are hidden within its container
  *  Errors in the UI come out as CORS violations
  *  An unmanaged default config is easily lost in forking

This change designates config.py as config-localhost.py and
references it by default in main.py in a constant,
CONFIG_OVERRIDE_FILE. This allows the application to deploy
out-of-the-box.

Resolves #57 
See also: #40
